On the CI server question, http://docs.codehaus.org/display/DAMAGECONTROL/C=
ontinuous+Integration+Server+Feature+Matrix has a pretty good comparison of=
 several different servers and their features.  Even though the page is on =
the DamageControl wiki, I think it's meant to be an independent page.

____=
____________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yah=
oogroups.com] On Behalf Of Wayne Fay
Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2007 9:04 AM=

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Ignore without recompile?

=


I'm not going to get into a big discussion of the merits of TestNG on
the=
 JUnit list... so you'll just need to do some research into that on
your ow=
n, or pose that question on the TestNG list. My group uses both
tools depen=
ding on the project and our specific needs so I honestly
can't tell you to =
use one vs the other. ;-)

As for Continuum... It comes from the same team =
working on the Maven
build tool and is a very nice CI server. It is newer t=
han
CruiseControl but there are a number of people using it and working on
=
it etc and the user list is rather active. They are working on v1.1
with a =
large number of new features etc so its taking some time.

As you mentioned=
, CruiseControl and Anthill are two other CI servers.
Most people I know ru=
n CruiseControl; I actually don't know anyone
personally who runs Anthill, =
but that doesn't mean much. I would take
a look at the various CI server ma=
iling lists, current/planned feature
lists, SCM check-ins and bug trackers =
to get a feel for which one is
the best fit for your team.

Wayne

On 3/8/0=
7, Niklas Saers <niklassaers@... <mailto:niklassaers%40gmail.com> > w=
rote:
> Thanks guys for your many answers. I have a couple of questions
> r=
egarding your suggestions:
>

ll used is this compared to

s before and see that
> lots of people use it. I've heared about TestNG bef=
ore and when
> researching my ignore problems I saw it and thought that its=

> different parameters for @Test looked intriguing. Does JUnit do stuff
> =
that TestNG doesn't that I should know that I'm sacrificing should I
> swit=
ch to TestNG?
>

=
> documentation and was released a year ago. This tells me that it is
> not=
 stable and well-tried and probably hasn't a big community
> submitting bug=
s and coming with feature requests. This of course is
> countered by 79 com=
mits last month. :-) What is the state of Continuum?
>
> How do CruiseContr=
ol, Continuum and Anthill compare to one-another?

pointers, it all looks like a much better deal
